definition: cavity of body/barrel (e.g. engine cylinder)/compartment/tune/accent of speech
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: We should be warm towards our comrades, not ice cold and indifferent.
sentences.chinese: 看待同志要满腔热忱，不能冷冷清清，漠不关心。

sentences.english: Funds were found and, armed with a wealth of enthusiasm, mother and daughter started out.
sentences.chinese: 资金终于凑足，怀着满腔热忱，母女俩出发了。

sentences.english: He took up his pursuit with ardor.
sentences.chinese: 他满腔热忱地从事工作。

sentences.english: I grinned as I finished with a strong sense of passion.
sentences.chinese: 带着满腔热忱，我完成了整套动作，笑逐颜开。

sentences.english: Full of confidence and zealousness, I want to do some foreign trade.
sentences.chinese: 我信心百倍，满腔热忱要把外贸做出来。

sentences.english: And China has now demonstrated that it intends to be a full-hearted participant in this process.
sentences.chinese: 如今，中国已经表明自己将满腔热忱地投入这个进程。

sentences.english: Wolfe embraced his new life with gusto.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔夫满腔热忱地迎接新生活。

sentences.english: Do not hire a man who does your work for money, but him who love it of it.
sentences.chinese: 不要雇佣为钱而来的人，他们需要对工作满腔热忱。

sentences.english: Full of confidence and zealousness , I want to do some foreign trade.
sentences.chinese: 我信心百倍，满腔热忱要把外贸做出来。

definition: pure and innocent like the heart of a newborn/sincere
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
to have one's heart filled with/(to collide) full on/(of farm animals) heavy with young
